com.xd.cps2002.map

Class Map

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.xd.cps2002.map.Map
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BasicMap

    public abstract class Map
extends java.lang.Object
    The Map abstract class provides a common interface for all the different types of map types. This acts as the abstract "product" class used to implement the factory design pattern for Maps. This class provides access to generic behaviour expected to be implemented by each map type. Hence, it allows client code to avoid type casting after initializing a new map instance using the MapCreator factory. The Map class was implemented as an abstract class rather than an interface since the only functionality that would be carried out differently by each subclass is the map generation and the way that that map is verified to be playable. Hence, all other functionality was implemented in this class so that it would be common to all subclasses.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected int size
      The size member stores the dimension of the square map (size x size tiles).
      protected TileType[][] tiles
      The tiles member stores the actual types for each tile on the map that the player can walk on.
      protected Position treasurePos
      The treasurePos member stores position of the treasure tile in the map.
      protected boolean[][] winnableTiles
      The winnableTiles member stores a 2D array of tiles from which a player can reach the treasure tile and win the game.

      Constructor used to initialize an empty Map object.
      protected Map(TileType[][] tiles)
      Constructor used to initialize a Map object with a pre-generated set of tiles.

    • Field Detail

      • size

        protected int size
        The size member stores the dimension of the square map (size x size tiles).

      • tiles

        protected TileType[][] tiles
        The tiles member stores the actual types for each tile on the map that the player can walk on.

      • treasurePos

        protected Position treasurePos
        The treasurePos member stores position of the treasure tile in the map.

      • winnableTiles

        protected boolean[][] winnableTiles
        The winnableTiles member stores a 2D array of tiles from which a player can reach the treasure tile and win the game. It is assumed that this array does not mark the treasure tile itself as winnable however, since a player should not start directly on a treasure tile. The reason why the class does not implement a function to directly return start positions for the players is so that the Map class can operate completely independently of the Player and Game classes.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Map

        protected Map(int n)
        Constructor used to initialize an empty Map object.
        Parameters:
        n - size of the n x n square map
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the method is given an invalid size parameter (outside of the range 5-50)
        Implementation Note:
        This constructor has a protected access modifier to stop client code from instantiating the class directly. However, unit tests and subclasses can still call the constructor normally.

      • Map

        protected Map(TileType[][] tiles)
        Constructor used to initialize a Map object with a pre-generated set of tiles.
        Parameters:
        tiles - a 2D array of TileType elements which represents the placement of the tiles in the map
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if tiles is null, empty or if the lists in the 2D array do not have the same lengths.
        Implementation Note:
        This constructor has a protected access modifier to stop client code from instantiating the class directly. However, unit tests and subclasses can still call the constructor normally.

    • Method Detail

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        Getter method used to get the size attribute of the Map object.
        Returns:
        the size of the map

      • generate

        public abstract void generate()
        Method used to randomly generate the map. This method should be implemented by each subclass of the Map class to allow different methods of map generation.
        API Note:
        Note that this function should also set the treasurePos member so that it can be used later in the function isPlayable().

      • isPlayable

        public abstract boolean isPlayable()
        Method used to check if the given map can be played by a player. This method should also be implemented by the sub-class given that map generation is also handled there.
        Returns:
        true if the player can reach the treasure starting from any point in the map.
        API Note:
        This function assumes that the treasurePos member has been set previously using either the Map(TileType[][]) constructor or the generate() function.
        Implementation Note:
        It is assumed that this function will also set the member variable winnableTiles while checking that the map is playable. Moreover this was left to be implemented by the subclasses since it assumed that given that they may generate maps differently, they may also need to traverse the maps differently as well.

      • isPositionWinnable

        public boolean isPositionWinnable(Position pos)
        Used to check if starting from a particular position the player can reach the treasure tile by just using up/down/left/right movements.
        Parameters:
        pos - The Position from which the treasure tile needs to be reached.
        Returns:
        returns true if the treasure tile can be reached from the given map position and false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if given a null Position argument.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if given a Position which does not exist in the map.
        API Note:
        The function expects that the position actually exists in the map. It also expects that the function isPlayable() has been run before, so that the member winnableTiles gets set beforehand.
        Implementation Note:
        Note that if the tile at pos is actually the treasure tile, the function returns false, since the player should not be able to start from this tile.

      • isValidPosition

        public boolean isValidPosition(int x,
                               int y)
        Function used to check if the given coordinate is a valid position which exists in the map.
        Parameters:
        x - x-coordinate in the map
        y - y-coordinate in the map
        Returns:
        true if the given (x,y) coordinate is a valid tile position in the map and false otherwise.

      • isValidPosition

        public boolean isValidPosition(Position pos)
        Function used to check if the given tile Position exists in the map. This function was implemented as a convenience function to allow use of the Position class.
        Parameters:
        pos - position in the map to be validated
        Returns:
        true if pos is a valid tile position in the map and false otherwise.
        Implementation Note:
        Note that this function returns false if the position is null. It does not throw an exception since it would not make sense given that the function is used for validation of positions.

      • getTileType

        public TileType getTileType(int x,
                            int y)
        Function used to check the type of the tile at the given coordinate in the map.
        Parameters:
        x - x-coordinate in the map
        y - y-coordinate in the map
        Returns:
        the type of the tile at position (x,y)
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the Map's tiles have not been set or generated yet.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if given a Position which does not exist in the map.
        API Note:
        The function indexes tiles in the map starting from (0,0), which is the tile in the upper left corner of the map.

      • getTileType

        public TileType getTileType(Position pos)
        Function used to check the type of the tile at the given Position in the map. This function was implemented as a convenience function to allow use of the Position class.
        Parameters:
        pos - position of the tile of interest in the map.
        Returns:
        the type of the tile at position pos
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the argument pos is set to null or if the Map's tiles have not been set or generated yet.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if given a Position which does not exist in the map.
        API Note:
        The function indexes tiles in the map starting from (0,0), which is the tile in the upper left corner of the map.
